avalancheActivity.highlights: Some new snow in the mountains. Thinn wind slabs may have formed in gullies and lows in W-facing aspects. Older snow is stable.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Some new snow in the mountains. Older snow underwent a lasting thaw and rain period and is stable. Thinn wind slabs may have formed in gullies and lows in W-facing aspects.  Mountaineers are advised to be careful where slabs may have accumulated in terrain traps.

travelAdvisory.comment: Uncertainty phase due to avalanche danger in the Eastfjords. Heavy snowfall and drifting snow in east Iceland on Sunday and Monday during strong NE winds. High avalanche danger is expected as the weather is passing, and wind slabs will likely form in gullies and on SW facing slopes. Decreasing precipitation and wind on Tuesday.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Uncertainty phase due to avalanche danger in the Eastfjords. Heavy snowfall and drifting snow in the east part on Sunday and Monday during strong NE winds. Increased avalanche danger.

weatherForecast.highlights: Breytileg átt, kólnandi veður og að  mestu þurrt næstu daga.

avalancheActivity.highlights: Unstable wind slabs expected in S-W facing aspects after NE wind and snow. Older snow is uniform and stable after thaw followed by freezing.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Unstable wind slabs expected in S-W facing aspects after NE wind and snow. During mild weather and rain January 10th-15th, the snow melted, settled, and layers broke down. Now temperatures have dropped below freezing, and snow should be stiff and stable.

travelAdvisory.comment: Uncertainty phase due to avalanche danger in the Eastfjords. Heavy snowfall and drifting snow in east Iceland on Sunday and Monday during strong NE winds. High avalanche danger is expected as the weather is passing, and wind slabs will likely form in gullies and on SW facing slopes. Decreasing precipitation and wind on Tuesday.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Uncertainty phase due to avalanche danger in the Eastfjords. Heavy snowfall and drifting snow in the east part on Sunday and Monday during strong NE winds. Increased avalanche danger.

weatherForecast.highlights: NA átt og lítilsháttar él á mánudag. Hæg breytileg eða suðlæg átt og að mestu þurrt þriðjudag og miðvikudag.

avalancheActivity.highlights: Unstable wind slabs expected after NE and E snowstorm.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Unstable wind slabs likely present in gullies and W-facing aspects after NE and E snowstorm on Saturday. Ongoing snowfall during strong E and NE wind until Tuesday. The old snow was most likely stable in most places.

travelAdvisory.comment: Uncertainty phase due to avalanche danger in the Eastfjords. Heavy snowfall and drifting snow in east Iceland on Sunday and Monday during strong NE winds. High avalanche danger is expected as the weather is passing, and wind slabs will likely form in gullies and on SW facing slopes. Decreasing precipitation and wind on Tuesday.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Uncertainty phase due to avalanche danger in the Eastfjords. Heavy snowfall and drifting snow in the east part on Sunday and Monday during strong NE winds. Increased avalanche danger.

weatherForecast.highlights: A-NA 13-20 m/s og snjókoma með köflum fram á þriðjudag en þá dregur úr vindi og úrkomu. Útlit fyrir hæga suðlæga átt á miðvikudag.

avalancheActivity.comment: Two avalanches released in in Breiðdalur on Jan 18th. An avalanche released in Tröllagil and a few sluffs in Bræðslugjár in Neskaupstaður. A small wet avalanche released in Fannardalur on Jan 12th.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Uncertainty phase due to avalanche danger in the Eastfjords from Sunday noon. Heavy snowfall during NE-wind on Sunday with slab formation. Ongoing snowfall on Monday

snowpackStructure.highlights: It snowed a lot on Sunday and uncertainty phase was declared at noon. Evacuation plans were activated in Neskaupstaður and Seyðisfjörður. Ongoing snowfall is forecasted on Monday. Thick wind slabs are likely present in the mountains, especially on S-W aspects and in gullies, which could be onstable at first. Observations on Saturday indicated a weak layer in the snow pack.

travelAdvisory.comment: Uncertainty phase due to avalanche danger in the Eastfjords. Heavy snowfall and drifting snow in east Iceland on Sunday and Monday during strong NE winds. High avalanche danger is expected as the weather is passing, and wind slabs will likely form in gullies and on SW facing slopes. Decreasing precipitation and wind on Tuesday.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Uncertainty phase due to avalanche danger in the Eastfjords. Heavy snowfall and drifting snow in the east part on Sunday and Monday during strong NE winds. Increased avalanche danger.

weatherForecast.highlights: Áköf snjókoma í NA hvassviðri fram á mánudagskvöld. Dregur úr vindi og ofankomu á þriðjudag.
